title: Justices of the Peace
body:
The decree of May 16, 1832, created a justice of the peace in each of the parishes that made up the judiciaries, and the same judge was to be elected by the people. The justices of the peace were intended to reconcile the parties, and from 1835 to 1840, they performed functions that previously belonged to the judges of the orphans.

The decree of March 29, 1890, determined that the justices of the peace would be appointed by the Government, and the decree of June 5, 1905, fixed the composition of the districts of justices of the peace of Funchal, Ponta do Sol, Santa Cruz, and São Vicente.

1832: Creation of the office of justice of the peace
1835: Start of the functions of the justices of the peace
1840: End of the functions of the justices of the peace
1890: Appointment of the justices of the peace by the Government
1905: Establishment of the composition of the districts of justices of the peace
